author: LAKE SUN newsroom@lakesunonline.com
title: Autumn Treat: A Pumpkin MECCA
text: Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 9:00 PM By LAKE SUN Posted Oct. 18, 2015 at 9:00 PM Camden County Take a sunny crisp, fall day, add in piles of pumpkins. hayrides and a family of farm critters and you have the perfect combination to make for a memorable day. What's better than loading up the kids, grandparents, and anyone else that wants to come along and hitting the road in search of the perfect pumpkin. Head west and not far from Camdenton, you'll find a pumpkin MECCA with an assortment of pumpkins sure to satisfy even the most discerning carver. The farm was started by the Kupfer family after discovering the joys of living in the country. The name came from the first initials of everyone in the family. Melissa, and Clay, who are the parents of Emily, Carley and Annie. The pumpkin patch started with a suggestion from a friend that they take up pumpkin farming after taking up residence on the 180 acre farm in 2013. There are lots of pumpkins to choose from. Hay rides, a petting zoo, corn crib, face painting, small corn maze, big slide, concessions and other great outdoor activities that make the farm a perfect family outing. When walking around, make sure you pick up one of the porcelain doll varieties. A portion from all of the porcelain doll pumpkin variety will be donated to Breast Cancer research. Make a day of it. The farm is open in October every Saturday and Sunday from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Want to go: Open Saturday and Sunday in October 10:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. www.meccafarm.com 573-280-3116 Directions: Hwy 54 West of Camdenton to Delmar on the right hand side of the road just past Davis Baskets. It is easy to find and right off the highway *Sorry no pets allowed except for service dogs. Park in the designated field and ride the hayride down to the pumpkin patch. By LAKE SUN
